name: SetCampaignContent
description:
Set the content for a campaign in Mailchimp.

Use this tool to update or set the content for a specific campaign in Mailchimp. It is called when you need to change or define what content is included in a campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Mailchimp campaign to set the content for. This ID is required to specify which campaign you are updating.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the campaign.

parameters.name: campaign_content
parameters.description: A JSON object defining the content of the campaign, including HTML, plain text, template, and more.

plain_text.description: The plain-text portion of the campaign. If left unspecified, we'll generate this automatically.

html.description: The raw HTML for the campaign.

url.description: When importing a campaign, the URL where the HTML lives.

id.description: The id of the template to use.

sections.description: Content for the sections of the template. Each key should be the unique [mc:edit area](https://mailchimp.com/help/create-editable-content-areas-with-mailchimps-template-language/) name from the template.

template.description: Use this template to generate the HTML content of the campaign

archive_content.description: The base64-encoded representation of the archive file.

archive_type.description: The type of encoded file. Defaults to zip.

archive.description: Available when uploading an archive to create campaign content. The archive should include all campaign content and images. [Learn more](https://mailchimp.com/help/import-a-custom-html-template/).

content_label.description: The label used to identify the content option.

plain_text.description: The plain-text portion of the campaign. If left unspecified, we'll generate this automatically.

html.description: The raw HTML for the campaign.

url.description: When importing a campaign, the URL for the HTML.

id.description: The id of the template to use.

sections.description: Content for the sections of the template. Each key should be the unique [mc:edit area](https://mailchimp.com/help/create-editable-content-areas-with-mailchimps-template-language/) name from the template.

template.description: Use this template to generate the HTML content for the campaign.

archive_content.description: The base64-encoded representation of the archive file.

archive_type.description: The type of encoded file. Defaults to zip.

archive.description: Available when uploading an archive to create campaign content. The archive should include all campaign content and images. [Learn more](https://mailchimp.com/help/import-a-custom-html-template/).

variate_contents.description: Content options for [Multivariate Campaigns](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-multivariate-campaigns/). Each content option must provide HTML content and may optionally provide plain text. For campaigns not testing content, only one object should be provided.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.
